1.text: Wash and dry your red peppers.

2.text: Cut a 2–3 ft (0.61–0.91 m) length of fishing line or cotton thread.

3.text: Tie one end of the fishing line or cotton thread around the stem of a chile.

4.text: Tie the other end of the line or thread through the eye of a needle.

5.text: Poke the needle through a chile’s stem above the base and pull the thread through.

6.text: Thread all your remaining chiles onto the line.

7.text: Tie an overhand knot in the line just above the top chile pepper.

8.text: Choose a warm, well-ventilated place to hang your bundle of peppers.

9.text: Use the excess line or thread to hang up the ristra.

10.text: Let the peppers dry for 2-4 weeks.
